column1: #Text=Two new species and additional records of Sinalthrobium Assing
#Text=1 College of Life Sciences, Shanghai Normal University, 100 Gulin Road,
#Text=1st Educational Building 323 Room, Shanghai, 200234, China Guangxi
#Text=Maoreshan National Nature Reserve, Guilin, Guangxi, 541001, China
#Text=New taxonomic and faunistic data for three species of the genus
#Text=detailed biomomic data and female sexual characters of S. lobrathioides
#Text=A key to the species of Sinalthrobium is
#Text=The small genus Sinalthrobium Assing, 2013 currently contains four
#Text=species scattered in the south of China: S. densepunctatum Assing, 2013
#Text=Sinalthrobium is allied to the widely distributed genus
#Text=Lathrobium Gravenhorst, 1802 by sharing a similar general habitus (the
#Text=morphology of the mouthparts, the broad neck, the absence of a
#Text=supramarginal line of the elytra, punctation of the pronotum, elytra and
#Text=abdomen, the ventral aspect of the head, thorax and abdomen), and the
#Text=presence of sexual dimorphism of tergites IX and X.
#Text=Sinalthrobium is distinguished from Lathrobium by the different
#Text=morphology of the head (more transverse, an uneven dorsal surface, with
#Text=dense and somewhat areolate punctation), the large and strongly bulging
#Text=eyes, the slightly more oblong mesoventirte, the stouter pronoun, the
#Text=coloration of the elytra, the truncate anterior margin of the male
#Text=sterinte VII (usually with a convex median projection in Lathrobium),
#Text=the simple internal sac of the aedeagus (usually with distinct internal
#Text=structures in Lathrobium), and by the different cheatotaxy of the female
#Text=This paper presents taxonomic and faunistic data for three Chinese
#Text=species, including two new species (Sinalthrobium assingi Chen & Peng,
#Text=sp. nov. and Sinalthrobium chenzhilini Chen & Peng, sp. nov.), and
#Text=detailed phonomic data for the previously unknown females of S.
#Text=The following abbreviations are used in the text, with all measurements
#Text=All material treated in this paper is deposited in the Insect Collection
#Text=are cited using the original spelling; different labels are separated by
#Text=Holotype.China - Chongqing * (); glued on a card with two
#Text=labels as follows: “China: Chongqing City, Chengkou County, Gaoxing
#Text=Xiang, West Daba Shan, Gou-Di-Tang; 3208N, 10837E; alt. 1830 m;
#Text=24.1V.2008; Huang & Xu leg.”HOLOTYPE: Sinalthrobium assingi sp. nov.,
#Text=Chongqing * (); Chengkou County, Gaoxing Xiang, West Daba Shan,
#Text=large, transverse yellowish spot posteriorly reaching lateral and
#Text=posterior margins; legs yellowish with darker femora; antennae dark
#Text=Figure 1: Habitus (A–C): A Sinaltrobium assingi sp. nov.
#Text=Head (Fig. 1D) transverse, widest across eyes; punctation coarse and
#Text=very dense, in median dorsal portion and on frons somewhat sparser;
#Text=0.80-0.83 times as long as postocular region in dorsal view.
#Text=distinctly coarser than that of head; interstices without microsculpture
#Text=Elytra (Fig. 1D) broader than pronoun; humeral angles weakly pronounced;
#Text=punctation coarse and rather dense; interstices without microsculpture
#Text=Abdomen somewhat narrower than elytra; punctation conspicuously dense
#Text=and fine on all tergites; interstices with distinct microsculpture and
#Text=subdued gloss; posterior margin of tergite VII with palisade fringe.
#Text=transverse, with shallow median impression without modified pubescence,

#Text=VIII F eadeagus in lateral view G eadeagus in ventral view.

#Text=without modified setae, posterior excision V-shaped and moderately deep;
#Text=aedeagus as in Fig. 2F, G, ventral process somewhat asymmetric, dorsal

#Text=sternite VIII (Fig. 2B) weakly oblong, and with strongly convex
#Text=posterior margin; tergite IX (Fig. 2C) with slender posterior processes;
#Text=tergite X flat, nearly reaching anterior margin of tergite IX.

#Text=closely related to S. assingi sp. nov. and S. lobrathioides (Assing,
#Text=It differs from S. assingi by the coloration of legs,
#Text=particularly by the distinctly sparser and finer punctation of the
#Text=pronutum, and by the differently shaped ventral process of the aedeagus.
#Text=It differs from S. lobrathioides by the somewhat longer elytra,
#Text=particularly by the sparser punctation of the head and pronutum, and by
#Text=the longer dorsal plate of the aedeagus.

#Text=The original description is based on a single male.
